title: Design Director
content:
MediaMonks Buenos Aires, a leading global digital production company, is seeking a talented Design Director. Collaborating with our international offices, you'll be responsible for leading a team of designers in creating award-winning work for top-name clients. As a member you'll be working with a diverse team of experts from around the world in Strategy, Creative, Experience Design, and Production to launch forward-thinking brands and new customer experiences in digital and beyond. 
As our Design Director, you'll bring innovative ideas, shape the vision and elevate the craft in our digital campaigns, products and platforms. You'll lead the design for entire projects, interface with clients, and collaborate with our team of talented Creative Directors, Design Directors, designers, art directors and writers. 
Key Responsibilities

Lead the team of visual and interface designers to guarantee the best quality of delivery, ensuring the work is both aesthetically pleasing and functional. When appropriate, lead by example and contribute your own hands-on design within projects.
Collaborate with creative directors and designers to shape and steer the look and feel of the user experience, campaigns and designing assets consistent with the brand's guidelines and vision.
Provide hands-on guidance throughout production in the form of animation guidance and pixel-pushing of the final product so that the creative output meets the highest of standards.
For digital platforms, you’ll always guard your designs to ensure it is consistent with the dev build.
Oversee and contribute to creating innovative design systems and motion systems for world-renowned brands.
Together with our creatives, animation teams and producers, leverage existing brand guidelines and conceptualize new ones to deliver a consistent, recognizable, and relevant brand point of view across different projects with a strategic vision.
Maintain and manage positive client relationships to increase the volume of single-bid work, acting as a client partner.
Motivate, inspire, and grow the skills of the designers who report to you by leading regular 1:1 management reviews and communicating needs to team members.
Look after the execution of the art direction and style guides, iterating templates and assets, and helping to improve the work by offering new angles and solutions.
Work closely with the ECDs, CDs, and other DDs to meet the Company and Creative Department’s annual and quarterly goals

 Experience  

8-10 years of digital experience, including 2 years in a lead-level capacity in digital production, with global experience preferred.
Strong portfolio of campaign, platforms, products spanning UX, UI, and interaction design.
Ability to create clear presentation decks that communicate UX thinking effectively and aid stakeholders in decision-making.
Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, and comfortable presenting and defending design choices.
Strong professional and interpersonal skills, with experience working collaboratively on high-end projects.
Proven track record in both product and campaign work, with excellent design skills and ability to get things done.
Philosophy on leadership that emphasizes mentorship and fostering growth of junior team members, with humility and ability to listen and learn.
Proficiency in design software, such as Figma and Adobe Creative Suite: Including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.

    Be Prepared to discuss things like: 

Your personal philosophy on design and user experience
Your portfolio or samples of work demonstrating your process for creating great user-centered design solutions
Client successes, disasters and how you’ve navigated them
Your favourite digital projects this year

#LI-FC1 #LI-MP1 #LI-HybridAbout Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
